alert.note: Alert for Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 10:19AM EST until January 05 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Chattahoochee River near Chattahoochee River above Roswell affecting Fulton County. For the Chattahoochee River Basin...including Chattahoochee River above Roswell...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Chattahoochee River near Chattahoochee River above Roswell. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9 feet, Flood stage is reached. The water reaches the bottom of the Ace Sand Company office and begins to flood the parking lot of Don White Memorial Park on Riverside Road...and the parking lot at the Azalea Park on Azalea Drive west of Roswell Road. Water will approach the tennis courts at the Huntcliff Club across from Azalea Park and begin to flood the road leading to the horse stables. The storm drains will no longer function properly at Riverside Road and Northcliff Trace. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this morning to 8.6 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to flood stage this evening. It will fall for the remainder of the period. - Flood stage is 9 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
